result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin W. Triplett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Justin W. Triplett is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Justin W. Triplett was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Justin W. Triplett was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
DE ordered to repay DA's office $2.50 for certified copy of JOC.
Submit to AODA assessment within 30 days and comply with any recommendations.

timeConds.notes:
Jail term is with huber and is to commence within 30 days of 12/5/16 with continued obedience to bond and with probation agents approval.  May be served in any county.  Jail sentence may be served on electronic monitoring at the discretion of the jail.
Consecutive to: Ct 4

records.addlTxt:
2:46 pm - DA calls case and states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Justin W. Triplett appeared with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schoenborn files waiver of preliminary examination form with court.  Court questions DE regarding waiver.  Waiver is accepted.  DA files information, acknowledged by parties, reading waived.    DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Cts 3 and 4.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC on Cts 3 and 4 and on motion of DA, dismisses Cts 1 and 2.  DE to submit DNA sample to PRSO.  Court imposes:

Ct 3 - Sentence withheld - 2 years probation
$200 fine
$250 DNAAS
$2.50 repayment to DA for certified copy of JOC
15 days jail with huber, and is to commence within 30 days of 12/5/16 with continued obedience to bond and with probation agents approval , and may be served in any county, cs to Ct 4
AODA and followthrough at discretion of probation agent

Ct 4 -  Sentence withheld - 1 years probation
$243 cc
5 days jail with huber, and it to commence within 30 days of 12/5/16 with continued obedience to bond and with probation agents approval, and may be served in any county, cs to Ct 3
AODA and followthrough at discretion of probation agent

Contraband to be destroyed after appeal time has expired

Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 5, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
Plea of Not Guilty and Demand for Jury Trial

Defendant Justin W. Triplett appeared with attorney Bryce Alan Schoenborn.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing requested, time limits waived.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.  Bond to continue.
and notice of intent to use DNA evidence

10:10am Defendant Justin W. Triplett appeared, in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called, appearances and possible charges stated.  Defendant's next court date is 9/27/16 at 10:00am.  court gives defendant notice of right to attorney and victim/witness intimidation form.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendaion.  Court orders $2,500.00 signature bond.  Conditions of bond:   If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.
